channel.title: Can't login to deltascape based server
channel.description:
So, I asked my friend which server source should I use, he told me he uses deltascape so I wanted to try it out too. I compiled, ran the run.bat, and opened silab's webclient. Then I tried to connect to 127.0.0.1 to see what things I should try adding. It loaded the interfaces, was there for a couple seconds and kicked me out. CMD line shows this: DeltaScape Server. Connection from 127.0.0.1:50113 [client-1-Sdfsf]: Loading Process Completed [Regular player, lag: 2 ms] [client-1-Sdfsf]: Invalid Server: DeltaScape.no-ip.info Game saved for player Sdfsf ClientHandler: Client Sdfsf disconnected (127.0.0.1)
My friend told me to replace DeltaScape.no-ip.info with 127.0.0.1, but he didn't remember what file. So, I looked at all the files and found it from client.java, replaced it with 127.0.0.1, compiled and ran. Tried connecting, same thing but it said [client-1-Sdfsf]: Invalid Server: 127.0.0.1 instead of DeltaScape. Now I don't really know what to do.
EDIT: I tried with moparscape client, it gave me this error: Error: T2 - 4,85,171 - 6,0,0 - 0,2,106,0,0,0, I've no idea what that means.

item.title: Can't login to deltascape based server

@mc_wobbla wrote:

[quote=“ProjectDiabolus, post:20, topic:254519”][quote author=Jei Jei KK link=topic=336327.msg2619002#msg2619002 date=1231240678]
Yes I were, I’m not stupid.
[/quote]
OMG LOL IRL[/quote]

LOL i saw the post, scrolled down waitingg for someone to quote that ^

Read full topic

item.title: Can't login to deltascape based server
item.dc:creator: @craig187 craig187
item.description:
@craig187 wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:21, topic:254519”][quote author=craig187 link=topic=336327.msg2619018#msg2619018 date=1231244856]

Fine. I came back to this community, seeking help on a project of mine, all I get is people whining at me. Since I can’t get any help, I’ll ditch the project.
Oh, and next time I won’t get help from here. One asshole less.
Thanks a lot.

Lol welcome to moparscape soon as you ask for help you get spammed with useless shit post like. OMG noob don’t you know how to java program omg obviously i don’t if i am asking for help. They don’t understand that when people asks for help that means they don’t know what there doing and need help, you don’t need to point out the fact that they can’t program and start abusing them for it.

Seriously i don’t even know why mopar forums has a help section 90% of time you just get spammed by ignorant shit heads who think there pro’s.
[/quote]
Unlike people like you that ask stupid questions like, “how do i add code 2 my servr, i fink i need to add a void or boolean or summin”.[/quote]

Why have a help section then?? Usually you add a help section to a forums to help people with there problems no matter how stupid they are. Even if you refuse to spoonfeed people don’t post useless shit in there threads we on the internet call that spam and on most forums it is a ban able offense.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't login to deltascape based server

item.title: Can't login to deltascape based server
item.dc:creator: @M00_M00_Pk M00 M00 Pk
item.description:
@M00_M00_Pk wrote:

sigh ofc, turned into a spam/flame war. Loving being back at Mopar.
Anyways, try connecting on localhost, your server could be stuck in an error loop? so i would try resetting, recompiling…

Complete restoration of your source could be your only hope if none of this works.
Or, try running the server on your backups.

But yeah, this time in the IP box;

‘localhost’

(no apostrophe’s.)

-Moo

Read full topic

item.description:
@Jei_Jei_KK wrote:

So, I asked my friend which server source should I use, he told me he uses deltascape so I wanted to try it out too. I compiled, ran the run.bat, and opened silab’s webclient. Then I tried to connect to 127.0.0.1 to see what things I should try adding. It loaded the interfaces, was there for a couple seconds and kicked me out. CMD line shows this:
DeltaScape Server.
Connection from 127.0.0.1:50113
[client-1-Sdfsf]: Loading Process Completed [Regular player, lag: 2 ms]
[client-1-Sdfsf]: Invalid Server: DeltaScape.no-ip.info
Game saved for player Sdfsf
ClientHandler: Client Sdfsf disconnected (127.0.0.1)

My friend told me to replace DeltaScape.no-ip.info with 127.0.0.1, but he didn’t remember what file. Now I don’t really know what to do.

EDIT: I tried with moparscape client, it gave me this error: Error: T2 - 4,85,171 - 6,0,0 - 0,2,106,0,0,0,
I’ve no idea what that means.
